toolkits.name: OCR Toolkit
toolkits.description: A collection of OCR technologies and libraries for extracting text from images and documents. Compare and rank different OCR solutions based on accuracy, speed, and use case.

technologies.name: Tesseract OCR
technologies.description: Open-source OCR engine developed by Google. Highly accurate for printed text, supports 100+ languages.
technologies.readme:
# Tesseract OCR

Tesseract is an open-source OCR engine developed by Google. It's one of the most popular OCR solutions for extracting text from images.

## Installation

```bash
pip install pytesseract
```

## Basic Usage

```python
import pytesseract
from PIL import Image

# Open image
img = Image.open('document.png')

# Extract text
text = pytesseract.image_to_string(img)
print(text)
```

## Features

- Supports 100+ languages
- Good accuracy for printed text
- Free and open-source
- Well-documented

## Limitations

- Slower than cloud-based solutions
- Requires image preprocessing for best results
- Less accurate for handwritten text

technologies.name: PaddleOCR
technologies.description: OCR toolkit powered by PaddlePaddle. Excellent for Chinese, English, and multilingual text recognition with high accuracy.
technologies.readme:
# PaddleOCR

PaddleOCR is an OCR toolkit powered by PaddlePaddle, designed for multilingual text recognition with excellent performance on Asian languages.

## Installation

```bash
pip install paddleocr
```

## Basic Usage

```python
from paddleocr import PaddleOCR

# Initialize OCR
ocr = PaddleOCR(use_angle_cls=True, lang='ch')

# Perform OCR
result = ocr.ocr('image.jpg', cls=True)

# Extract text
for line in result:
    print(line[1][0])
```

## Features

- Excellent for Chinese, Japanese, and Korean text
- High accuracy
- Fast inference speed
- Supports multiple languages

## Best For

- Asian language documents
- Multilingual text recognition
- Real-time OCR applications

technologies.name: EasyOCR
technologies.description: Ready-to-use OCR with 80+ languages support. Easy to use with minimal configuration.
technologies.readme:
# EasyOCR

EasyOCR is a ready-to-use OCR library that supports 80+ languages with minimal configuration.

## Installation

```bash
pip install easyocr
```

## Basic Usage

```python
import easyocr

# Initialize reader
reader = easyocr.Reader(['en', 'fr', 'es'])

# Read text from image
result = reader.readtext('image.jpg')

# Print results
for detection in result:
    print(detection[1])
```

## Features

- Supports 80+ languages
- No preprocessing required
- Easy to use API
- Good for beginners

## Best For

- Quick prototyping
- Multi-language documents
- Simple text extraction tasks

technologies.name: AWS Textract
technologies.description: Cloud-based OCR service from AWS. High accuracy with built-in document understanding capabilities.
technologies.readme:
# AWS Textract

AWS Textract is a cloud-based OCR service that uses machine learning to extract text and data from documents.

## Installation

```bash
pip install boto3
```

## Setup

Configure AWS credentials:
```bash
aws configure
```

## Basic Usage

```python
import boto3

# Initialize client
textract = boto3.client('textract', region_name='us-east-1')

# Analyze document
with open('document.pdf', 'rb') as document:
    response = textract.detect_document_text(
        Document={'Bytes': document.read()}
    )

# Extract text
for item in response['Blocks']:
    if item['BlockType'] == 'LINE':
        print(item['Text'])
```

## Features

- Very high accuracy
- Document understanding capabilities
- No setup or maintenance required
- Highly scalable

## Best For

- Production systems
- Large-scale document processing
- Complex document layouts

toolkits.author: Data Team

toolkits.name: PDF Parser Toolkit
toolkits.description: Comprehensive collection of PDF parsing libraries and tools. Compare different approaches for extracting text, tables, and metadata from PDF documents.

technologies.name: PyPDF2
technologies.description: Pure Python PDF library. Simple and lightweight for basic PDF operations.
technologies.readme:
# PyPDF2

PyPDF2 is a pure Python library for working with PDF files. It's lightweight and simple to use.

## Installation

```bash
pip install PyPDF2
```

## Basic Usage

```python
import PyPDF2

# Open PDF file
with open('document.pdf', 'rb') as file:
    reader = PyPDF2.PdfReader(file)
    
    # Extract text from all pages
    text = ''
    for page in reader.pages:
        text += page.extract_text()
    
    print(text)
```

## Features

- Pure Python implementation
- Lightweight and fast
- Simple API
- No external dependencies

## Limitations

- Basic text extraction only
- No table extraction
- Limited PDF/A support

technologies.name: pdfplumber
technologies.description: Extract text, tables, and visual elements from PDFs. Excellent for structured data extraction.
technologies.readme:
# pdfplumber

pdfplumber is a Python library for extracting text, tables, and visual elements from PDF files with excellent layout preservation.

## Installation

```bash
pip install pdfplumber
```

## Basic Usage

```python
import pdfplumber

# Open PDF
with pdfplumber.open('document.pdf') as pdf:
    # Extract text from first page
    first_page = pdf.pages[0]
    text = first_page.extract_text()
    print(text)
    
    # Extract tables
    tables = first_page.extract_tables()
    for table in tables:
        print(table)
```

## Features

- Excellent table extraction
- Preserves document layout
- Good for structured PDFs
- Actively maintained

## Best For

- Table extraction
- Structured documents
- Form data extraction

technologies.name: pypdf
technologies.description: Modern fork of PyPDF2 with improved features and active maintenance.
technologies.readme:
# pypdf

pypdf is a modern fork of PyPDF2 with improved features and active maintenance.

## Installation

```bash
pip install pypdf
```

## Basic Usage

```python
from pypdf import PdfReader

# Open PDF file
reader = PdfReader('document.pdf')

# Extract text
for page in reader.pages:
    text = page.extract_text()
    print(text)
```

## Features

- Active maintenance
- Improved error handling
- PDF/A support
- Better performance than PyPDF2

## Best For

- Text extraction
- PDF manipulation
- Metadata operations

technologies.name: Camelot
technologies.description: Extract tables from PDFs. Specialized tool for table extraction with high accuracy.
technologies.readme:
# Camelot

Camelot is a specialized Python library for extracting tables from PDF files with high accuracy.

## Installation

```bash
pip install camelot-py[cv]
```

Note: Requires Ghostscript to be installed separately.

## Basic Usage

```python
import camelot

# Extract tables from PDF
tables = camelot.read_pdf('document.pdf', pages='1')

# Access first table
first_table = tables[0]

# Convert to DataFrame
print(first_table.df)

# Export to CSV
first_table.to_csv('table.csv')
```

## Features

- Excellent table extraction accuracy
- Multiple extraction methods (lattice, stream)
- Preserves table structure
- Export to various formats

## Best For

- Table extraction from PDFs
- Structured data extraction
- Financial reports and forms
